result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Luis Salazar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all of following by end of supervision.  Pay all Court costs and mandatory costs including the DNA surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervisin.  DOC shall colect those sums.  Any amount remaining due an dowing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All applicable fees of supervision.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two; consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 254 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Defendant is not to be employed in an environment with children.
Mental health assessment and treatment.  Psychological evaluation.

No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
Only use and possession of medication as prescribed medication.
No association with drug use, drug dealing or the drug community.
No contact wit victims or victims mother.
No third party contact with victims or victims mother.
No contact with any child under the age of 16.
No contact with any child under the age of 18 without a chaperone and without approval of agent.
No operating a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.

Sex offender evaluation and treatment.
Find stable residence.
Report car license and make and model of vehicle to agent.
Mandatory sex offender registry.
Any electronic devices in defendant's possession must be turned over to the agent upon demand.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary.  Absolute sobriety monitored by random urine screens and breath tests.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not vote until civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (27 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing 01-15-2016 received and filed.
dated 1/11/2016 from the defendant, received and filed

Defendant Jose Luis Salazar in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Jose Luis Salazar in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court has reviewed the PSI and defense Alternative Presentence Investigation reports.  No amendments made to either reports.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by mother of the victims as read by victim advocate Jane M.

As to Count 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  35 YEARS with 254 days credit CONCURRENT with Count 2; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 20 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 YEARS.
As to Count 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  35 YEARS with 254 days credit CONCURRENT with Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 20 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 YEARS. 
These sentences run CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- sex offender evaluation and treatment
- mental health assessment and treatment
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- psychological evaluation
- Absolute sobriety monitored by random urine screens and breath test
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs
- only use and possession of medication as prescribed medication
- no association with drug use, drug dealing or the drug community
- no contact with victims or victims mother
- no third party contact with victims or victims mother
- no contact with any child under the age of 16
- no contact with any child under the age of 18 without a chaperone and without approval of agent
- Obtain a GED/HSED
- vocational and educational training
- Seek and maintain full-time employment.  Defendant is not to be employed in an environment with children.
- find stable residence
- no operating a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
- report car license and  make and model of vehicle to agent
- mandatory sex offender registry
- any electronic devices in defendant's possession must be turned over to the agent upon demand
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.
Pay all court cost and mandatory costs including the DNA surcharges;
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  the Court ordered that all court costs and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered PSI and Alternative Presentence Investigation reports sealed.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA commencing 06/19/2015 received and filed. (26 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Tom Harris, Public Defender Appointment.
Defendant to be produced at the next court date.

Defendant Jose Luis Salazar in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Jose Luis Salazar in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defense request another adjourned scheduling conference.  Defense to possibly withdraw plea.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
received and filed. lms

Defendant Jose Luis Salazar in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Jose Luis Salazar in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

New counsel has been appointed.  Defense needs discovery from previous counsel and to request the plea transcript.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jose Luis Salazar in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Jose Luis Salazar in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has filed a pro se motion to withdraw counsel and plea.  Due to a conflict of interest with counsel, defendant request new counsel.  Motion of the defendant for withdrawal of counsel is granted by the Court.   Court did not issue ruling as to Defendant's motion to withdraw plea.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 6.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
NOTICE OF AND MOTION REQUESTING AN ORDER REMOVING ATTORNEY GREGORY RENDEN FROM CASE.  AN ORDER WHICH INCLUDES THE WITHDRAWAL OF DEFENDANT'S GUILTY PLAN, received and filed. lms

On motion of the State, Court ordered presentence investigation. Order for presentence investigation filed; copy to Probation Dept.  
Case adjourned to 8-21-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 6.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  
All parties are notified that effective August  3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Ellen Brostrom, Branch 6,  in Room 423 of the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS OF AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Jose Luis Salazar in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Jose Luis Salazar in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered charges amended to: 
Count 1: First Degree Sexual Assault of a Child, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.02(1)(e), 939.50(3)(b), a Class B Felony;
Count 2: First Degree Sexual Assault of a Child, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.02(1)(e), 939.50(3)(b), a Class B Felony.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Jose Luis Salazar not in court, in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however Branch 10 is in jury trial. Request for an adjournment by the defese agreeded upon by the parties. Defense counsel to review jury instructions 2502 (980) with the defendant before the next court date. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Jose Luis Salazar not in court, in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 10.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jose Luis Salazar in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Jose Luis Salazar in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: DS (dob: 12-31-2007); II (dob: 12-21-2005); Magdalena G and family; Larry and Barron (witnesses); Other Acts Witnesses: LLR-K (dob: 4-15-2003); SRG (dob: 7-6-2005).

Defendant Jose Luis Salazar in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Jose Luis Salazar in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  
Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
